summary:
Mesopotamia, an ancient region in West Asia, is modern-day Iraq and parts of nearby countries. It's where some of the world's oldest civilizations began around 10,000 BC. People here invented the wheel, grew the first crops, and created writing.

From 3100 BC, the Sumerians and Akkadians ruled. Then, many empires rose and fell, like the Akkadian and Assyrian empires. In 539 BC, the Achaemenid Empire took over, followed by Alexander the Great and the Seleucids. Later, Mesopotamia was fought over by the Romans and Parthians. By the 7th century, Muslim conquests brought the region under Islamic rule.
title: Mesopotamia
